chairman of salomon brothers inc., spoke at harvard university last night about the volatile state of the american economy in the face of a plummeting stock trade. as the self-proclaimed" father of the securitized mortgage market, Lewis Ranieri said his experience in the capital markets has given him insight into the recent economic turmoil. Lewis Ranieri said businesses need to continue to take risks to ensure there is a market in the future, but he warned that with those risks businesses need to maintain disclosure and transparency to keep institutions safe from collapsing. Lewis Ranieri viewed the bailout as one such beneficial risk. $ 700 billion can make a real dent[ in this crisis] if it is used well, " Lewis Ranieri said. Lewis Ranieri focused on moral questions plaguing today's stock trade, arguing that stock brokers who short-sell
